articles.title: Syrian rebel leader’s victory speech holds a message for Iran - and for Trump and Israel too
articles.description: Abu Mohammad al-Jolani’s road to Damascus has been long. He has talked openly about his change along the way. From young al Qaeda fighter two decades ago, to rebel commander espousing sectarian tolerance.
articles.content:
CNN —
Abu Mohammad al-Jolani’s road to Damascus has been long. He has talked openly about his change along the way. From young al Qaeda fighter two decades ago, to rebel commander espousing sectarian tolerance.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump's Bold Moves: Pardons, Deportations, and Legal Battles
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump announces plans to pardon Jan. 6 defendants, supports the deportation of illegal immigrants, and upholds the nomination of Pete Hegseth despite allegations of misconduct. Concurrently, a large defamation verdict against Alex Jones stands, and the White House considers broader clemency after Hunter Biden's pardon.
articles.content:
President-elect Donald Trump has made a series of bold pre-office announcements. In a recent NBC News interview, Trump confirmed he would not replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell upon taking office.
Meanwhile, he vowed immediate action to pard... [432 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: World in Flux: Leaders, Conflicts, and Resolution Efforts
articles.description: The summary highlights current global news: Trump calls for a Ukraine ceasefire, Romanian elections annulled, Israeli Gaza hospital strike denial, Trump's plans to pardon Jan. 6 defendants and deport illegal immigrants, Assad's asylum in Russia post Syria's capital fall, and Mahama's election victory in Ghana.
articles.content:
Donald Trump has urged an immediate ceasefire in the Ukraine conflict following his meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy. Both Kyiv and Moscow have stated preconditions for negotiations.

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.title: Trump vows to pardon January 6th Capitol rioters on day one of his second term
articles.description: There could be `exceptions’ to a pardon if individuals had acted `radical’ or `crazy’ during the assault, says Trump
articles.content:
President-elect Donald Trump said in an interview that aired on Sunday that he would act on his first day in office to pardon rioters involved in the January 6th, 2021 Capitol attack, further building expectations for a broad granting of clemency.
“I... [4808 chars]

articles.author: The Inquisitr
articles.title: Woman Has 13 Surgeries In One Year So She Could Look Like Her ‘Role Model’ Ivanka Trump
articles.description: 'Botched' experts suggested that it is common for people to jump into plastic surgery procedures after a traumatic event.
articles.content: A woman underwent 13 plastic surgeries in a bizarre attempt to resemble President-elect Donald Trump’s eldest daughter, Ivanka Trump, 43. Tiffany Taylor appeared on E! Network’s Botched to meet with top-notch plastic surgeons Paul Nassif and Terry Du... [3008 chars]

articles.title: Trump says Jill Biden 'couldn't have been nicer' during Paris chat
articles.description: Despite their long history of making nasty remarks about each other during the two election cycles, Trump told The Post in a wide-ranging phone interview Sunday that he had a positive interaction with President Biden's wife.
articles.content:
President-elect Donald Trump said outgoing first lady Jill Biden “couldn’t have been nicer,” after the pair were spotted having a very friendly encounter during the reopening of the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.

articles.title: Donald Trump calls for Russia's Vladimir Putin to reach 'immediate' settlement with Ukraine
articles.description: Mr Trump urged the warring sides to "stop the madness", saying "negotiations should begin" as he admitted he was actively working to end the near three-year-old conflict.
articles.content:
Donald Trump has urged Vladimir Putin to reach an immediate settlement to end the war in Ukraine, saying it was the Russian president's "time to act".
